articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ, JOSEPH B. FREDERICK and STEFANIE DAZIO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The pro-Palestinian demonstration that paralyzed Columbia University ended in dramatic fashion late Tuesday, with police carrying riot shields swarming the Ivy League campus, bursting into an administration building protesters took over the previous night and making dozens of arrests.
articles.title: Police clear pro-Palestinian protesters from Columbia University’s Hamilton Hall

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged Tuesday to launch an incursion into the southern Gaza city of Rafah, where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are sheltering from the almost 7-month-long war, just as cease-fire negotiations between Israel and Hamas appear to be gaining steam.
articles.title: Netanyahu vows to invade Rafah 'with or without a deal' as cease-fire talks with Hamas continue

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON, SCOTT BAUER and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: WAUKESHA, Wis. (AP) — Donald Trump on Wednesday will use a one-day break from his hush money trial to rally voters in the battleground states of Wisconsin and Michigan, a day after he was held in contempt of court and threatened with jail time for violating a gag order.
articles.title: Trump returns to campaign facing a warning of jail time if he violates a trial gag order

articles.author: JONATHAN J. COOPER
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — President Joe Biden may eventually ban TikTok, but he's moving to give something back to the young people who dominate the popular social media app — a looser federal grip on marijuana.
articles.title: Biden's historic marijuana shift is his latest election-year move for young voters

articles.author: DAVID FISCHER and STEPHANY MATAT
articles.description: BOCA RATON, Fla. (AP) — Florida's ban on most abortions after six weeks of pregnancy, before many women even know they are pregnant, went into effect Wednesday, and some doctors are concerned that women in the state will no longer have access to needed health care.
articles.title: Florida's 6-week abortion ban takes effect as doctors worry women will lose access to health care

articles.author: TIM SULLIVAN
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — It was the music that changed first. Or maybe that’s just when many people at the pale brick Catholic church in the quiet Wisconsin neighborhood finally began to realize what was happening.
articles.title: 'A step back in time': America's Catholic Church sees an immense shift toward the old ways

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — A surprise announcement that revealed Haiti’s new prime minister is threatening to fracture a recently installed transitional council tasked with choosing new leaders for the gang-riddled Caribbean country.
articles.title: The unexpected announcement of a prime minister divides Haiti's newly created transitional council

articles.author: ERIK VERDUZCO and JEFFREY COLLINS
articles.description: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — Law enforcement officers with an arrest warrant demanded that a man come out of a house in North Carolina before four were killed by gunfire, the victims unable to survive shots coming from inside the dwelling, a witness and officials said Tuesday.
articles.title: 4 officers killed in North Carolina were at disadvantage as shots rained from above, police say

articles.author: TERRY TANG
articles.description: It has been almost 50 years since the U.S. government established that Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders and their accomplishments should be recognized annually across the nation.
articles.title: Nearly 50 years later, Asian American and Pacific Islander month features revelry and racial justice

articles.author: DEREK GATOPOULOS
articles.description: KRYO PIGADI, Greece (AP) — Skimming over miles of hills blackened by wildfires west of Athens, Fire Lt.
articles.title: Greece boosts special firefighting units to cope with its growing heat risk
